DOC.HEAD: `Christmas Vacation' No. 1 at the Movies
DOC.TEXT: ``National Lampoon's Christmas Vacation'' was the nation's No. 1 movie last weekend, displacing the dark comedy ``The War of the Roses.'' ``She-Devil,'' teaming TV's Roseanne Barr and Oscar winner Meryl Streep, fell from fourth to out of the Top 10, and the Eddie Murphy-Richard Pryor collaboration ``Harlem Nights'' dropped from sixth to 10th place. Warner Bros.' ``Christmas Vacation,'' starring Chevy Chase, moved up from second on a $7.23 million return last weekend while ``The War of the Roses,'' with Kathleen Turner and Michael Douglas as dueling spouses, slipped to No. 2. ``Back to the Future Part II'' was third. The film has collected $75.5 million since Thanksgiving weekend. Disney's animated feature ``The Little Mermaid'' was fourth and ``The Wizard,'' starring TV's young Fred Savage as a video game whiz, opened at No. 5. ``Family Business,'' starring Dustin Hoffman, Sean Connery and Matthew Broderick, had a disappointing debut, earning $2.1 million and finishing sixth. Finishing seventh was the all-star ensemble ``Steel Magnolias,'' and the pairing of two other big stars, Robert DeNiro and Sean Penn, produced an eighth-place debut for ``We're No Angels.'' The Paul Newman-starring ``Blaze,'' the story of Louisiana Gov. Earl Long's love affair with stripper Blaze Starr, opened at No. 9 with $1.7 million. Joining ``She-Devil'' in the drop from the Top 10 were ``Look Who's Talking,'' ``Prancer'' and ``All Dogs Go to Heaven.'' Here are the top movie ticket sales for the weekend as tallied by Entertainment Data and Exhibitor Relations Inc. 1. ``National Lampoon's Christmas Vacation,'' Warner Bros., $7.23 million weekend gross, 1,950 screens, $3,709 per screen, $33.64 million total gross, three weeks in release. 2. ``The War of the Roses,'' 20th Century Fox, $6.98 million, 1,395 screens, $5,000 per screen, $19.18 million, two weeks. 3. ``Back to the Future Part II,'' Universal, $4.41 million, 2,023 screens, $2,180 per screen, $75.54 million, three weeks. 4. ``The Little Mermaid,'' Disney, $2.52 million, 1,249 screens, $2,019 per screen, $28.94 million, five weeks. 5. ``The Wizard,'' Universal, $2.14 million, 1,155 screens, $1,855 per screen, $2.14 million, one week. 6. ``Family Business,'' Tri-Star, $2.13 million, 1,201 screens, $1,773 per screen, $2.13 million, one week. 7. ``Steel Magnolias,'' Tri-Star, $2.09 million, 1,102 screens, $1,900 per screen, $30.7 million, five weeks. 8. ``We're No Angels,'' Paramount, $2.05 million, 1,239 screens, $1,652 per screen, $2.05 million, one week. 9. ``Blaze,'' Disney, $1.74 million, 909 screens, $1,913 per screen, $1.74 million, one week. 10. ``Harlem Nights,'' Paramount, $1.72 million, 1,324 screens, $1,302 per screen, $49.48 million, five weeks.
